intro: Euphrosyne xanthiifolia, commonly known as the golden-leaf euphrosyne, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other ornamental and economically important plants. Euphrosyne xanthiifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique leaf color and compact growth habit.
